sentences.sentence: The Nightingale( 夜莺 ) and The Rose
“She said that she would dance with me if I brought her red roses,”
said the young Student, as his beautiful eyes filled with( 充满 ) tears( 眼泪 ).
“But there is not one red rose in my garden.”
The Nightingale( 夜莺 ) heard him from her nest( 鸟巢 ) in the Oak Tree( 橡树 ),
and she looked out through the leaves, and wondered.
“Not one red rose in my entire garden!”
he said again, and the tears( 眼泪 ) began to run down his face.
“How easily does happiness come and go!
I have read all the books that wise men have written, and yet my life is miserable( 悲惨的 ) because I cannot find one simple red rose.”
“At last, here is a true lover,” said the Nightingale( 夜莺 ).
“Night after night I have sung of him, even though I did not know him.
Night after night I have told his story to the stars, and now I see him.
His hair is as dark as the night sky, and his lips( 嘴唇 ) are as red as a rose,
but love has made his face as pale as the moon, and sadness has left its mark on his face.”
“The Prince( 王子 ) is hosting( 举办 ) a dance tomorrow night,” the young Student said quietly to himself.
“And the girl I love will be there.
If I bring her a red rose, she will dance with me until the sun rises.
I will hold her in my arms, and she will put her head on my shoulder.
And then I will hold her hand in mine.
But there is no red rose in my garden, and so she will pass me by.
I will sit by myself and feel lonely.
She will not notice me, and my heart will break.”
“Here indeed is a true lover,” said the Nightingale( 夜莺 ).
“What I sing about, he suffers( 受苦 ).
What is happiness to me, is pain to him.
Still, I am certain that love is a wonderful thing.
It is more precious( 珍稀的 ) than sapphires( 蓝宝石 ), and dearer than fine rubies( 红宝石 ).
Gold and money cannot buy it, and it cannot be sold in the market.”
“The musicians will play their instruments,” said the young Student, “and my love will dance to the sound of the music.
She will dance so lightly that her feet will not touch the floor, and everyone else will be dancing all around her.
But she will not dance with me, because I have no red rose to give her.”
As he said this, he threw himself down( 扑向 ) on the grass, held his face in his hands, and cried.
“Why is he crying?” asked a little Green Lizard( 蜥蜴 ), as he ran past the Student with his tail in the air.
“Why, indeed?” said a Butterfly( 蝴蝶 ), who was flying around in the sunshine.
“Why, indeed?” said a Flower to his neighbor in a soft, low voice.
“He is crying for a red rose,” said the Nightingale( 夜莺 ).
“For a red rose?” they cried out.
“How foolish( 愚蠢的 )!” said the little Lizard( 蜥蜴 ), laughing loudly.
But the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) understood the secret of the Student’s sadness,
and she sat silently in the Oak Tree( 橡树 ), thinking about the mystery( 奥秘 ) of love.
Suddenly she spread her brown wings and flew into the sky.
She passed through the forest like a shadow( 影子 ), and like a shadow( 影子 ) she drifted across( 翩然飞过 ) the garden.
In the center of the garden, there stood a beautiful Rose Tree,
and when she saw it, she flew over to it, and landed on a branch( 树枝 ).
“Give me a red rose,” she said, “and I will sing you my sweetest song.”
But the Tree shook its head.
“My roses are white,” it answered.
“They are as white as the light of the moon at midnight, and whiter than the snow on top of the mountain.
But go to my brother who grows around the old Fountain( 喷泉 ), and perhaps he will give you what you want.”
So the Nightingale( 夜莺 ) flew over to the Rose Tree that was growing around the old Fountain( 喷泉 ).
“Give me a red rose,” she said, “and I will sing you my sweetest song.”
But the Tree shook its head.
“My roses are yellow,” it answered.
“They are as yellow as the light of the sun at noon, and yellower than the sunflowers that grow in the fields.
But go to my brother who grows outside the Student’s window, and perhaps he will give you what you want.”

article_info.previous: 严冬的时候，燕子冻死在快乐王子的脚下，王子的心碎成两半。天使把王子的心和死去的燕子当做城市中最宝贵的东西带给上帝后，上帝让他们在天堂永久快乐地生活下去。结束了王子与燕子的凄美故事，今天开始欣赏《夜莺与玫瑰》。
article_info.share_words: Suddenly she spread her brown wings and flew into the sky. She passed through the forest like a shadow, and like a shadow she drifted across the garden.

question.cn: 为什么年轻的男学生在哭泣？
question.en: Why did the young Student cry?

options.cn: 他找不到一朵红色的玫瑰花。
options.en: He couldn’t find a red rose.
He did not pass his exam.

analysis: 文中提到：“ ‘She said that she would dance with me if I brought her red roses,' said the young Student, as his beautiful eyes filled with tears. 'But there is not one red rose in my garden.’ ”以及后面男学生的话中，可以看出他找不到一朵红色的玫瑰花送给喜欢的女孩，因此选A。

question.cn: 夜莺为什么要帮助男学生找到红玫瑰？
question.en: Why did the Nightingale try to help the Student to find a red rose?

options.cn: 她认为爱情是很美妙的东西，并且男学生是个有情人。
options.en: She thought love was a wonderful thing and the Student was a true lover.

options.cn: 她想给自己找点儿事做。
options.en: She wanted to find something to do.
The Student asked her for help.

analysis: 文中夜莺认为男学生是个有情人，而夜莺本身也认为爱情是一件很棒的事情，她想帮助男学生找到红玫瑰，因此选A。

question.cn: 明天晚上谁将要举行一场舞会呢？
question.en: Who was hosting a dance tomorrow night?

analysis: 文中提到：“The Prince is hosting a dance tomorrow night. ”因此选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第36天
